page.topic: Create a new Alpha Anywhere Workspace
page.description: Every Alpha Anywhere application begins with a Workspace. Learn how to create a new workspace for a mobile or web application by following this step-by-step guide.

group.title: Important Notice for Community Edition Users

description.p: This tutorial was built using the full Alpha Anywhere Development Environment. Community Edition users may encounter screens that don't match their environment due to differences between the two development environments.
We strongly recommend starting with the tutorials in the *[extlink:Alpha Software Learning Center@https://learn.alphasoftware.com]* to start learning Alpha Anywhere.

figure.title: A new, blank Alpha Anywhere workspace.

section.description: To create a new mobile or web application with Alpha Anywhere, you must create a new workspace. A workspace contains all files your application needs, including files such as components, javascript libraries, images, HTML pages, .a5w pages, and css style sheets. Let's create a new, blank Alpha Anywhere workspace.

step.description: Launch Alpha Anywhere. Under the *[ui:File]* menu, select *[ui:New Workspace...]* to create a new Alpha Anywhere project.

figure.title: Create a New Workspace from the File menu.

step.description: Enter a name for your new workspace.

If the *[ui:Startup Control Panel]* appears, check the box for *[ui:Open the Web Control Panel when this Workspace is opened]* if you plan to use this workspace to create a Web or Mobile application. The Web Control Panel is where all of the resources for a web or mobile application are listed. Click *[ui:OK]* to finish creating your new workspace.

figure.title: Specifying the Web Control Panel should be opened when the Workspace is opened.

section.description: Now that you have created a workspace, you can start building your application.

figure.title: A new, blank Alpha Anywhere workspace.
